definition: to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: At first I wanted to stop it, but I left them be.
sentences.chinese: 一开始我还想去劝架，后来还是算了。

sentences.english: Seeing the two guests of honor bickering, the rest of the group formed a bucket brigade to calm them.
sentences.chinese: 看到两位贵宾争吵起来，其余的人便协力劝架。

sentences.english: I went over and tried to sort it out but I got involved.
sentences.chinese: 我走过去想劝架，但是我也被卷入进去。

sentences.english: Those who in quarrel interpose must often wipe a bloody nose.
sentences.chinese: 去劝架的人，常常搞到要抹自己的鼻血。

sentences.english: John, why don't you stop them fighting?
sentences.chinese: 约翰，你怎么不上去劝架？

definition: to try to stop a fight/to intervene in a fight
to fight together/to come to blows
to soothe/to pacify/to mollify/to mediate (in a dispute etc)
to fight/to scuffle/to come to blows/CL:場|场[chang2]
to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
(dialect) to come to blows/to have a row
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
